docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 13 -- By a vote of 17 to 1, the Tenth Inter-American Conference adopted today an anti-Communist resolution advocated by the United States. It was designed to serve as a warning to the Soviet Union to keep out of the affairs...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 13 -- By a vote of 17 to 1, the Tenth Inter-American Conference adopted today an anti-Communist resolution advocated by the United States. It was designed to serve as a warning to the Soviet Union to keep out of the affairs of the Western Hemisphere.
docs.abstract: US anti-Communist resolution approved, 17-1; Guatemala opposed; Mex and Argentina abstain; vote size seen special victory for Dulles and US; Colombian amendment stressing need for consultation before action against Communism accepted; rejected amendments revd; Sen Hickenlooper comments

headline.main: AMERICAS MEETING BY 17 TO 1 ADOPTS U. S. CURB ON REDS; Margin of Agreement on Peril Regarded as Outstanding Success for Dulles

docs.snippet: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 14 (AP) -- Louise Suggs stood off heavy pressure today and won her second women's Titleholders golf championship with a record 293 for the seventy-two holes.
docs.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 14 (AP) -- Louise Suggs stood off heavy pressure today and won her second women's Titleholders golf championship with a record 293 for the seventy-two holes.

headline.main: Miss Suggs, With 293, Wins Titleholders Golf by 7 Strokes

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 15 -- The Tenth Inter-American Conference condemned racial discrimination today and called on the twenty-one American republics to enact legal and educational measures for its abolition.
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 15 -- The Tenth Inter-American Conference condemned racial discrimination today and called on the twenty-one American republics to enact legal and educational measures for its abolition.
docs.abstract: Inter-Amer Conf: pol com, 19-0, approves Sra Remon (Panama) resolution condemning racial discrimination; urges legal and educ measures for its abolition; Guatemala abstains; Asst Sec Holland and Min Toriello comment; speakers explain recent votes on US anti-Communist resolution; Dominican Repub withdraws its anti-Communist proposals

headline.main: PARLEY CONDEMNS RACIAL PREJUDICE; Hemisphere Republics Agree Practice Gives Aid to Reds -- Guatemala Abstains

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 17 -- The Latin-American countries cautioned the United States today not to dump its agricultural surplus on world markets at reduced prices.

docs.abstract: Latin Amer cautions against 'dumping' surpluses in world markets at cut prices, Inter-Amer Conf; Eisenhower appts group headed by C Francis to study distribution

headline.main: U. S. IS CAUTIONED ON FOOD DUMPING; Latin Americans Frown on Flooding World Markets With Surplus Stocks

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 17 (AP) -- Enrique Bertolino of Argentina shot a course record 64 in the second round of the Uruguay international golf tournament today to take a four-stroke lead with a thirty-six hole total of 132.

headline.main: BERTOLINO IN GOLF LEAD; Argentine Shoots Record 64 in Montevideo Tourney

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 19 -- The Latin-American states voted tonight that the Inter-American Conference call on industrialized member states -- meaning the United States -- to refrain from any restrictions on imports of raw materials.
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 19 -- The Latin-American states voted tonight that the Inter-American Conference call on industrialized member states -- meaning the United States -- to refrain from any restrictions on imports of raw materials.
docs.abstract: approves resolutions on encouraging favorable conditions for private foreign capital investments, on limiting competition of new foreign capital with estab businesses, and for rise in pub financing of econ development
